name: 曾祥森
objective:
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The content of Calculus(I)
includes: 1.Functions and Limits, 2.Differentiation, 3. Applications of Differentiation,
4.Integration, 5.Applications of Definite Integrals, 6. Transcendental Functions.
schedule:
Week 1 --- Functions, The limit of a function, Calculating limits
Week 2 --- Limits involving infinity, Continuity
Week 3 --- Differentiation, Derivatives and rates of change,
         Differentiation formulas, Derivatives of trigonometric functions
Week 4 --- The chain rule, Implicit differentiation, Related rates,
         Linear approximations and differentials    ( First Test)
Week 5--- Extreme values of functions, The mean value theorem
Week 6--- Monotonic functions, Concavity
Week 7--- Test for local extrema, Curve sketching
Week 8--- Optimization problems, Newton’s method, Antiderivatives
Week 9--- Midterm exam
Week 10 –Areas, The definite integral, Evaluating definite integrals
Week 11 –The fundamental theorem of calculus, Indefinite integrals,
         The substitution rule
Week 12 –Application of definite integral, Area between curves
Week 13 –Volumes of solids of revolution, Length of curves,
         Surface area of solids of revolution      (Second Test)
Week 14 –Works, Moments and center of mass, Fluid pressures and forces
Week 15 –Inverse functions, Transcendental functions, Logarithmic and
         exponential functions, Inverse trigonometric functions
Week 16 –Exponential growth and decay, Hyperbolic functions
Week 17 –Indeterminate forms, L’Hospital’s rule
Week 18 –Final exam
scorePolicy:
GRADE
1. Homeworks 20%
2. Seminar session 10%
3. Tests(2) 30%
4. Midterm exam 15%
5. Final exam 25%
